tags: i am genuinely GENUINELY scared for avengers
did i mention i love ben mendelson in this one 'cause i do
summary: shout-out to the guy who shouted “YEAH, RIGHT!” at the screen at Jude Law’s “I’m SO proud of you” comment at Carol. I hear you....
body:
shout-out to the guy who shouted “YEAH, RIGHT!” at the screen at Jude Law’s “I’m SO proud of you” comment at Carol. I hear you. I see you. I heart you.

also, they showed the avengers: endgame trailer, first time i’m seeing it on the big screen and i all but burst into tears then and there. i do not know how to handle this movie, i am genuinely scared, oh em gee.

also also, captain marvel is so damn s a t i s f y i n g. it only got better with the second viewing.

also also also -
captain marvel: YAY! FLY, CAROL, FLY! YAY, AVENGERS! YAY HAPPINESS AND WHOLESOMENESS AND -
mid-credits scene: cry. (but- ) Cry. (BUT-) C R Y !

summary: I don’t really remember, but ... IIRC the refugees weren’t exactly overjoyed to see Talos. His family was happy to see him, of...
caption:
I don’t really remember, but … IIRC the refugees weren’t exactly overjoyed to see Talos. His family was happy to see him, of course, but …

Okay, when Rambeau saw Danvers it was like seeing a ghost. She thought she was dead, and yet there she is six years later. That was a shock, but a good shock.

The refugees? They had a bad shock.

They had been waiting 6+ years since the last time they saw Mar-Vel. They must have guessed that she was dead, but there was always hope. Hope that Mar-Vel was still alive. Hope that her dream to end the war was still alive.

But when Talos showed up? That could only mean that Mar-Vel was indeed dead. Whatever shred of hope they had been clinging onto was crushed.

blog.name: gerundsandcoffee
blog.title: Bean ちゃ ま
blog.description: PT hopskotching through fandom.Coffee queue in the morning. Currently doing "chama sketch challenge".Header from @quatraquartzart. Icon from @artofhau

body:
Captain Marvel

Only one in the theataaaaaah!!!

The absolute least believable part of the movie was that not a single face was sweating in the Louisiana summer. Please get real.

Fury and Carol laughing after she has been shot down so many times by the Kree for her humor? It was so great to see her remembering how good it is to be herself.

The Skrull! As GOOD guys! Or at least, less bad guys. This puts Ronan’s zealotry in an even worse light. But I’m ready for Captain Marvel 2: MCU still has a captain.

Ugh, that first post-credits trailer- I’ll be seeing Endgame, after all. And I guess shredding my heart with everyone else.

summary: Dr. Strange when he saw all those futures: oh fuck the only way we can possibly win is by calling this ridiculously powerful...
body: Dr. Strange when he saw all those futures: oh fuck the only way we can possibly win is by calling this ridiculously powerful woman to help us but she’s halfway across the galaxy and the only way to contact her directly is through Fury’s pager but we don’t have time to contact Fury about that before Thanos wins so I guess we all have to die first and hope Fury can call her in time.

blog.description: The title says it all.

summary: Not to be a killjoy, or anything
body:
Not to be a killjoy, or anything

But I’ve seen a bunch of people posting that they made several good reviews about Captain Marvel with different accounts, as some sort of counter to the troll reviews that tried to bomb the movie.

How is this spamming of possitive reviews any different from the spamming of the troll ones?

summary: Captain America: sweet boy, bit of an idiot, broken moral compass but always doing his best, battle is a necessary evil, doesn’t...
body:
Captain America: sweet boy, bit of an idiot, broken moral compass but always doing his best, battle is a necessary evil, doesn’t believe in no win scenarios

Captain Marvel: shouts with glee while watching her enemies burn, op and knows it, soft but only for three people, doing right is more important than doing good, can and will always win

summary: So, I was watching the latest Patrick (H) Willems video - this one about the MCU and what he believes is a lack of real change*,...
caption:
So, I was watching the latest Patrick (H) Willems video - this one about the MCU and what he believes is a lack of real change*, and I found these arctic takes in the comments.

1. America is not a fascist nation. Ironically, it’s the folks who oppose Trump who often want to dissuade crimethinkers by any means necessary, including force. Oh, and they also often want the public to be disarmed and helpless against government tyranny. They also tend to be authoritarian and statist.

2. Drone strikes were going on before Obama, though he did make a lot more of ‘em then Bush. Also, the SHIELD ubercarriers were manned. I guess you could see the drone parallel if you squint.

3. Are you saying Trump, who was openly called “fascist” and “white supremacist” infiltrated the minds of the body politic? The man is not exactly known for his subtlety. If you’re arguing that the Russians infiltrated America, I’d like to point out how Steve a) didn’t fight the Russians, and b) Black Widow is a Russian. 

Cap 2 was deliberately designed so the right and the left can see what SHIELD is doing is wrong. “Shady government agencies should not have an unquestioned monopoly on force” is a pretty obvious position. Moreover, it’s justified, in part, by something HYDRA didn’t plan for; The Battle of New York. If they had planned something to give them an excuse they could not have done better.

And, of course;

Remember a few weeks ago? When feminists defending the Gillette ad said feminism attacks toxic masculinity so men can express their feelings?

Compare and contrast that with how feminists reflexively attacked the critics of Captain Marvel and Brie Larson’s remarks by portraying the critics as “trolls” and whiny manbabies. You know, using the same sort of shaming they say they’re against. The same shaming many defenders of the Gillette ad used, in fact.

There’s a reason I keep saying feminism’s worst enemies are feminists.

* I don’t agree.

summary: I’d like everyone to know that Carol Danvers deserves this movie and much more after what Avengers 200 did to her. Watch as one...
body:
I’d like everyone to know that Carol Danvers deserves this movie and much more after what Avengers 200 did to her. Watch as one guy picks apart the comic that did the terrible, horrible, no good, very bad thing to Captain Marvel (still Ms. Marvel at the time this comic was made) page by page and tear it a new one verbally. Seriously, if anyone hasn’t heard of it, watch this video. It needs to be seen to be believed. 

Never forget.

I’d like everyone to know that Carol Danvers deserves this movie and much more after what Avengers 200 did to her. Watch as one guy picks apart the comic that did the terrible, horrible, no good, very bad thing to Captain Marvel (still Ms. Marvel at the time this comic was made) page by page and tear it a new one verbally. Seriously, if anyone hasn’t heard of it, watch this video. It needs to be seen to be believed. 

Never forget.
